page.title: 01 A TRIP AROUND THE BLOCK
page.content: The North Eastern corner of our block is dominated by the Trent Valley. The land is flat there and used mostly for farming. This changes to wooded hills and glacial valleys of Cannock Chase to the South. The main residential areas are Rugeley and the villages of Brereton, Armitage, Hill Ridware and Mavesyn Ridware. There is a major road, A51 running roughly North to South. The London to North West railway and the Trent and Mersey canal also cut through the block. Two power stations dominate the scene.These with Lea Hall Colliery, Thorn Automation and Amitage Shanks, all to be found off the A513, constitute the main industries in the area.There is an industrial estate off the A51 in Brereton.The main amenities are within the residential areas.
